@Devnet Validator
The devnet version floor is scheduled [1] to raise to v1.16.0 at the start of epoch 541 (early next week). Nodes running unsupported versions will fork off after the epoch boundary. If you have any objections to this plan please engage on the activation thread [2] in #devnet-feature-gates.

Devnet is currently running v1.16.5 [3]. Please upgrade your devnet nodes before epoch 541.

For more information about feature gate activations see the schedule [1] and #devnet-feature-gates on Discord [2]

The recommended version for devnet is currently v1.16.5 [3]

Some minor bugs in v1.16 have delayed the devnet upgrade, so we're postponing the feature gate activations. The new v1.16 release will be available by Monday. We expect to start activating v1.16 feature gates on devnet the week of July 31st. Please plan to upgrade any devnet nodes to v1.16 next week, or let me know if you can't.
@Mainnet Beta Validator we need your help! Please, if you hit the GPF on v1.16 share it on â mb-validators and make sure to fill out the survey to help us find the root cause.

@Mainnet Beta Validator
There is ongoing debugging of an issue that may be related to v1.16 (see the #debug-gpf-1_16 channel on discord).  The issue appears to be isolated to a small subset of validators who have adopted v1.16 so we would like to add an extra step to the incremental upgrade and see 17% of stake adopt v1.16 to see if the trend continues:

If you would like to volunteer and are able to monitor your node while <17% of stake has already upgraded to v1.16 and <5% of stake is delinquent, then please upgrade to: 
https://github.com/solana-labs/solana/releases/tag/v1.16.13 

Also, for operators who have adopted v1.16, or attempted to adopt and reverted to 1.14, please fill out this survey:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfKehzdxTj_fp3aJEDq0Tn2VpOyeKXYF8fKcI242-84aKy3pA/viewform?usp=sf_link
to help with debugging the ongoing GPF investigation.

ğŸ“£Devs, if you are using Starknetâ€™s feeder gateway, here is an important update for you:

The Starknet feeder gateway will go through changes in Q4 2023 and will stop serving multiple types of queries. It will retain only synchronization-related endpoints for Full Nodes.

The Starknet feeder gateway serves as a gateway for querying the centralized sequencer on the state of Starknet. It was meant to be a temporary solution until Full Nodes supporting Starknetâ€™s JSON-RPC mature and can meet the ecosystem's needs.

We are working with the different API providers to ensure they're preparing for the deprecation regarding reliability and expected increased traffic.

We will proceed with the deprecation only if we feel the ecosystem is ready.

Moving towards Full Nodes and API services signifies transitioning from a centralized solution to a decentralized, resilient, and efficient system that aligns with blockchain technology principles.

Starknet devs are recommended to shift to API services or Full Nodes like Pathfinder, Juno, and Papyrus.

For a full list of Full Nodes and API services ğŸ‘‡

https://starknet.io/en/ecosystem/fullnodes-and-api-services

Read more and join the discussion.

https://community.starknet.io/t/feeder-gateway-deprecation/100233

In the coming weeks we will deprecate the public API of Starknet, and we will completely remove it in the future. This shift is driven by our commitment to push decentralization and enhance Starknetâ€™s resilience and independence. 

Weâ€™re actively encouraging the Starknet dev community to transition to using one of Starknet full nodes Pathfinder, Juno or Papyrus, or one of the existing API services. 


To ease this transition, we've curated a selection of alternative solutions and resources to help you become familiar with their features and capabilities.

1/4 The future is here, with the introduction of CometBFT v0.38 â˜„ï¸ (thread)
This release includes the much-awaited second part of ABCI++ with methods like ExtendVote & VerifyVoteExtension.
Unlocking the potential of ABCI++ within the #interchain
2/ Previously, v0.37 introduced the 1st part of ABCI++, which provides application developers access to two new methods: PrepareProposal & ProcessProposal.

Stargate continues to support Fantom as an ecosystem. You can still bridge your $STG, $WOO and all OFTs to and from Fantom.

Per the mandate, the DAO will continue to explore additional assets to be added in future.

Following the recent DAO vote, Stargate is winding down the Fantom pool.
Users will no longer be able to transfer USDC to or from Fantom on Stargate, effective immediately.
Users who have provided liquidity on Fantom are still able to withdraw their USDC on Fantom and should do so.
Emissions on this pool have been set to 0, and it has been disconnected from all other pools on Stargate.
Pathweights to and from Fantom have also been set to 0.
As mandated by the proposal, Stargate has removed any POL from the Fantom pool and deposited this into the Ethereum USDC pool.
Please note that this proposal does not affect the transfer of OFTs.
You can read the proposal that was passed here: https://snapshot.org/#/stgdao.eth/proposal/0xe485f7c2bb4f7843d4ce353ae82f19dcf017e70e917bad28f70ff8b231b57deb

GMX End of Week Update: 

Development: 
GMX Contracts: 
-Added contracts to simplify GLP to GM migration, this will allow a simpler process for those looking to swap their GLP to GM. 
-Improved validation for existing limit and trigger orders to notify users about potential errors and non-executable orders, currently in testing
Wallet Integration: 
-Rainbow kit is implemented and users can now use a variety of wallets with GMX app and integration with new wallets in future will be a smoother and quicker process
-Upgraded wallet system and add support for new wallets like Rabby, Argent, Ledger etc

Leaderboard: 
Leaderboards now show data in all networks, the UI is improved and optimized for mobile devices

Chainlink Integration: 
New keepers with new Chainlink realtime feeds were tested and are working fine on testnet

GMX End of Week Update: 

Development: 

Sub-Account Implementation: 

Development of sub-accounts continues, this will allow an account to authorize another account to create orders on its behalf, which will allow features like creating orders without requiring a signing popup every time.

-Added contracts to enable order creation without a signing popup using sub-accounts

Chainlink Integration: 

-Chainlink realtime feed are supported and keeper side and are being tested on testnet

Frontend Improvements: 

-Fixed app crashes and notifications issues when the application tab is inactive for a long time were fixed in production

-Updated stats overview for V2 like Total Volume, Fees, Liquidity, Long/Short/Open Interest should now be visible on the Dashboard page.
https://app.gmx.io/#/dashboard

Leaderboard Development: 

-Work continued on leaderboard development adding new columns to the Top Positions, added a way to filter by markets, prettified the UI and improved the page performance.

Please see the Github for the latest updates to the codebase https://github.com/gmx-io/gmx-synthetics#gmx-synthetics and https://github.com/gmx-io/gmx-interface/

The updated Vulcan Launcher is now available on our website to download. We have made some improvements as outlined below:

KEY CHANGES âœï¸

IMPACT (PLEASE READ) :ForgeHammer: 
If you have never installed the Launcher or a game, proceed as you should. Download the launcher, then download the game you want to play and enjoy.
If you currently have the â€˜oldâ€™ launcher, you can keep using it for now should you want to â€“ but bear in mind we will stop updating games on it at some stage.

You should uninstall the current version of the game(s) you are playing first (this is optional â€“ but suggested as the game will only take up unnecessary hard drive space).
Install the new launcher.
Install the game you want to play.

Hi @here!  Just a note for you based on VulcanVerse issues last week (Thurs 7th) with the introduction of version 1.2.5 - on Elysium(!) :Elysium: 

Staking was initially distributed for that day based on a user's individual average based on a period of time before that date. Following a discussion, we're now to adjust the staking reward to be the actual daily calculation, same as every other independent day. :VulcanVerse: 

A reminder - we have in place the XP stockpile system, where a user can earn enough XP to fill up the bars to cover several days. This means that short term VulcanVerse issues aren't too much of a problem as you only need fill those bars to cover staking XP.

Thanks to our team of VulcanVerse and My Forge devs, the majority of bugs that appeared as we migrated have been squashed ğŸ’¥ - there are a couple of ongoing issues that we're aware of, rest assured these will be dealt with as we work to finalize migration.

@here Just an update as we work on restructuring Discord - it'll no doubt be confusing for a short while, for those of us used to the old layout. But as we've covered in the blog, we've archived some little used or outdated channels, combined others (such as the social share channels, now â content-creators covers all of that), made new categories as well as renaming some channels and creating new ones elsewhere. All of this with the aim of uncluttering and grouping channels logically.

There are some legacy channels that we'll keep for a short while and the likes of â the-great-migration - which are temporary, will eventually be archived. There's a new, dedicated â vulcanverse-talk channel purely for the VV discussion. The lounge (aka off topic) now fits our theme a little, it's the â vulcan-city-taverna 

There are dedicated â elysium-help and â metascapes-help channels in the Elysium and MetaScapes categories, but all other support is under the Support category.

The Campaigns + Events category covers current events and so the channels within it will be temporary to one degree or another.

Testers, the @Game Council and wiki editiors get their own section, only visible to those involved ensuring there is less clutter.

The Misc category contains â commands, â ask-talos and, when we host them, the quiz channel.

The Vulcan Studios category contains channels for our games - bigger games have their own channel, there is also an 'other games' channel to cover the rest. Use the â reaction-roles to ensure you can see the channels with the games you want to follow. 

There's surely more I haven't covered and still a couple of sections to tidy up, but that's enough to take in for now! :ForgeHammer:

ğŸš¨ On-chain Proposal: Upgrade the GovernanceStrategy Smart Contract ğŸš¨

ğŸ—³ Wintermute has created an on-chain proposal to upgrade the GovernanceStrategy Smart Contract to V2. This upgrade will ratify the implementation of $wethDYDX into dYdX v3â€™s governance system, so that $wethDYDX has the same voting and proposal power as $ethDYDX.

View the on-chain proposal ğŸ‘‰ https://dydx.community/dashboard/proposal/15 

ğŸ•‘ Voting Ends: Sep 23, 2023, at 17:06 UTC 

Details about wethDYDX and the GovernanceStrategyV2 Smart Contract;
1ï¸âƒ£ The wethDYDX Smart Contract could enable a permissionless and autonomous one-way bridge for the $ethDYDX token to be migrated from Ethereum to the dYdX Chain.
2ï¸âƒ£ $wethDYDX is a transferable ERC-20 token based on Ethereum Mainnet that is issued 1:1 when $ethDYDX tokens are sent to the wethDYDX Smart Contract.
3ï¸âƒ£ Upon a successful on-chain vote, a user holding $wethDYDX will be able to participate in dYdX v3 governance (voting and proposing). This is important to ensure dYdX v3's governance system remains robust, if and when more $ethDYDX tokens become permanently locked. 

Note, This DIP falls under the Long Timelock Executor, that has a 1 day delay, 10 days voting period (assuming average of 13.2 second block time), and followed by 7 days queuing time â³
https://docs.dydx.community/dydx-governance/voting-and-governance/governance-process#long-timelock-executor

Details about wethDYDX and the GovernanceStrategyV2 Smart Contract
1ï¸âƒ£The wethDYDX Smart Contract could enable a permissionless and autonomous one-way bridge for the $ethDYDX token to be migrated from Ethereum to the dYdX Chain.
2ï¸âƒ£$wethDYDX is a transferable ERC-20 token based on Ethereum Mainnet that is issued 1:1 when $ethDYDX tokens are sent to the wethDYDX Smart Contract.

10 day voting period,
100M ethDYDX Quorum and Vote Differential, and
7 day timelock delay

ğŸš¨ Governance AnnouncementğŸš¨ 

Someone has created a Snapshot poll to "skip testnet round 3, and go live with BETA v4". 

Note, the dYdX Foundation is discouraging participation in the Snapshot vote and warning the dYdX community to avoid interacting with the Eth address that created the Snapshot vote because:

(1) there are reports that the address (0xa2A55dB3C3504e1C98286b9AB7c89213f3570288) that created the Snapshot vote was used in a phishing scam, 
(2) the dYdX community has no control over the testnet for dYdX v4, and
(3) there was no discussion on the dYdX community forum and this proposal did not follow the Proposal Lifecycle.

The dYdX Foundation urges the dYdX ecosystem, community members and the general public to remain vigilant as we anticipate an increase in potential scams and phishing attacks.

Any single actor, entity, or protocol exceeding key thresholds - 1/3 being  critical - is a threat to Ethereum's security, neutrality, and legitimacy 

There are dozens of great solutions out there. Protect your capital by staking with a minority solution

https://github.com/djrtwo/writing/blob/main/docs/2022-05-30_the-risks-of-lsd.md

:Flame_Orange::SpiderTanks1:  Spider Tanks Patch 1.4.0 is live! :SpiderTanks1::Flame_Orange: 

Greetings @everyone, the time has come again for some major upgrades to the Spider Tanks arena! 
Patch 1.4.0 introduces lots of features that improve the game and make it even more exciting.

Among other things, this patch brings:
Drop Pods v2: More choice for how long you send them out, the option to return them early, and the ease of redeploying or unpacking all.
P&E View v2: WAY more info on your rewards. Bodies, Weapons, Nodes, Maps, and Drop Pods now also show more reward statistics.
Report system v2: A revamped report, muting, and banning system to better combat disruptive behavior in-game.
Killfeed v2: New killfeed notifications, Domination, Revenge, First Blood and improved Killfeed UI.
Freecam: Spectators of exhibition matches can now freely navigate their camera around the battlefield.
Gamemode frequency changes: Changed probabilities of getting certain gamemodes based on the community survey.
Numerous Improvements and Fixes
Lots of Balance Adjustments

Want to know more? You'll find all the details and the entire changelog in the Spider Tanks Discord. 
Make sure to join it here: â¡ï¸ https://discord.gg/spidertanks

Thought that was all?
The Spider Tanks store also sees some new releases with much requested and discounted Component Bundles!
Ranging from Common to Ancient, these bundles are sure to come in handy when upgrading your tanks. 

Additionally, we've introduced four brand-new starter bundles in the store to help get aspiring captains started!
Check them all out here: https://app.gala.games/games/spider-tanks

:polygon_circle: The moment weâ€™ve all been waiting for has arrived. Phase 0 of Polygon 2.0 is now underway, 3 Polygon Improvement Proposals (PIPs) and a roadmap for Phase 0 have been introduced today.

ğŸŒ Polygon 2.0 aims to scale Ethereum blockspace to create the Value Layer of the Internet, providing unlimited scalability and unified liquidity.

The proposals detail the initial set of technical upgrades required to deliver this vision:
Initiation of POL upgrade.
POL to serve as the native (gas) token for PoS.
POL to serve as the staking token for PoS.
Launch of the Staking Layer, enabling validators to participate in a myriad of services across multiple chains in the Polygon 2.0 ecosystem.

ğŸª· No immediate action is required today for users of PoS and zkEVM networks, but what is needed from the community is your invaluable input.

PIP #17
PIP #18
PIP #19

:polygon_circle: Polygon CDK (Chain Development Kit) is an open-source and modular codebase that anyone, anywhere can use to easily launch their own ZK-powered L2 chain on Ethereum!

By connecting to a common ZK bridge, every chain is also seamlessly interoperable â€“ linked to the whole Polygon ecosystem... :polygon:

In practice, this allows for near-instant finality and cross-chain execution among all Polygon chains. Native interoperability meets automatic, shared liquidity. Chains deployed using Polygon CDK rely on the security of cryptography, rather than the social requirements and incentives necessary in fraud proofs. No need for users to run full nodes that check whether or not transactions are valid â€“ chain states are proved by math.

Polygon ID is open source technology that can enable decentralized identity. The Polygon ID protocol supports a variety of identity verification methods, from documents to biometrics and more. The goal of Polygon ID is to enable a self-sovereign identity (SSI) layer for the web

Meet UniswapX âš¡â€” a new permissionless, open source (GPL), auction-based protocol for trading across AMMs & other liquidity sources. Weâ€™re starting to roll UniswapX out as an opt-in beta in the Uniswap WebApp starting today. 

TL;DR: over time, itâ€™ll give users more liquidity, better prices, MEV protection, & gas-free swapping!

UniswapX outsources the complexity of routing to an open network of fillers who compete to fill swaps at the best prices. What does this mean for swappers? As a competitive ecosystem of fillers forms, it will bringâ€¦

ğŸ’¸ Better prices 
â›½  Gas-free swapping
ğŸ¤ MEV protection
ğŸ¤© No cost for failed transactions

How is it gas free? â›½ ğŸ†“
Swappers sign an offchain order, which is submitted onchain by fillers who pay gas on swappersâ€™ behalf to complete the transaction. Swappers donâ€™t need a chainâ€™s native token to trade and donâ€™t have to pay for failed transactions ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥

And what about MEV protection? 
MEV is one of the biggest issues facing onchain swapping today.

With UniswapX, MEV that would be left on the table to be captured by an arbitrage transaction is instead returned to swappers through improved prices ğŸ’°

Later this year, weâ€™ll launch a cross-chain UniswapX that combines swapping and bridging into one action âš”ï¸

Swappers will be able to swap between chains in seconds ğŸ’¨ 

This includes native asset swaps, reducing the need for bridged tokens 

UniswapX is built into the same interface you know and love, with the same principles of security, self-custody, and community that make Uniswap the most trusted name in DeFi ğŸ¦„

As always, our code has been extensively tested & audited ğŸ”’
https://github.com/Uniswap/UniswapX/blob/main/audit/ABDK.pdf

Our Vision for Uniswap v4
All about our vision for Uniswap v4 and why we're building in public.
Uniswap v4 enables powerful new ways to customize liquidity pools by introducing â€œhooksâ€.
Hooks add entirely new functionality to pools, such as dynamically adjusting fees or creating new order types ğŸª
https://uniswap.org/blog/uniswap-v4

Weâ€™ve written a few sample hooks to demonstrate their expressiveness & capabilities:
âŒ› Time-weighted average market maker (TWAMM)

ğŸ“– Onchain limit orders
https://github.com/Uniswap/v4-periphery/tree/main/contracts/hooks/examples

Because each pool can be customizable, we expect to see pools of all shapes and sizes.
To meet a world with many pools, we made a number of architectural improvements ğŸš€

https://github.com/Uniswap/v4-core/blob/main/whitepaper-v4-draft.pdf

v4 pools will live in a single contract, reducing the cost of pool creation by 99% ğŸ”‚
When combined with a new â€œflash accounting" system, this greatly reduces the cost of routing across many pools âš¡

With custom pools and singleton, developers can leverage the security & network effects of Uniswap, without needing to build their own AMM from scratch.

ğŸ¦¾ We want Uniswap v4 to bring fast, expressive AMM innovation within one powerful ecosystem.

Delivery vs. Payment (DvP) settlement across two separate blockchains is a fundamental leap forward for the global financial system. 

Made possible by CCIP.                                                                                                                            

What is DvP? 

DvP is a form of settlement that requires payment for securities to be made before or at the same time as the securities are delivered. In other words, it ensures you get what you pay for. 

How did DvP work before blockchains?

Before blockchains, DvP settlement required trusting a centralized intermediary to facilitate the transaction. But all this did was swap one counterparty for another, albeit usually a larger counterparty with less solvency risk. It made settlement safer, but it didnâ€™t make it safe. 

Why is Web3 a leap forward for DvP settlement?

DvP powered by Chainlink CCIP is a highly secure, flexible, and trust-minimized settlement process. Regardless of whether assets are stored on a private bank chain or public blockchain, CCIP can facilitate the secure settlement of assets without the need to trust any centralized intermediary or institution. Instead, asset owners can rely on smart contracts and cryptographic truth. 

Where weâ€™re at right now:

ANZ is at the forefront of this innovation, using CCIP to demonstrate how tokenized assets can be settled securely cross-chain. But this is just the beginning. 

As the blockchain interoperability standard for capital markets, CCIP is on a path to underpin DvP settlements for markets transacting hundreds of trillions of dollars annually. 

CCIP is set to #LinkTheWorld
https://blog.chain.link/tokenization-for-capital-markets/

The smart contract ecosystem is constantly evolving, whether it be from dApps migrating to 
layer-2 networks or adopting alternative blockchains, fluctuating gas costs due to network congestion, or the evolution of dApps across a variety of use cases. As a result, Data Feeds within the Chainlink ecosystem are continuously evaluated for their usage and economic viability across all the blockchains and layer-2 networks they are deployed on.

Data Feeds without publicly known active users may be scheduled for deprecation. Doing so not only helps preserve blockchains as public goods by optimizing blockspace usage, but it helps reduce unnecessary costs incurred by Chainlink node operators. This process is part of a broader ecosystem shift towards Chainlink Economics 2.0, designed to maximize the adoption of the Chainlink protocol while optimizing for cost-efficiency and long-term economic sustainability. Over time, new Data Feeds may be launched or relocated to alternative blockchains/layer-2s that better reflect current user demand.

Hey there,

Our Optimism Bedrock mainnet feeds and Chainlink Automation services are now live and ready for consumption.

Let us know if you experience any issues or have any questions.

Hey there,

Following the successful migration of the Optimism mainnet to Bedrock, we have initiated the process of bringing Chainlink Data Feeds and Chainlink Automation services live.
During this time, we advise not consuming Chainlink Data Feeds or using Chainlink Automation. As our tests come to completion, we'll start making the services available. We'll keep you updated once all services are available to use!

In the meantime, let us know if you have any questions.

Hello,

As part of Optimism's roadmap to transition to the OP tech stack, the Optimism Mainnet will migrate to Bedrock on June 6th at 16:00 UTC. During this process, Optimismâ€™s Mainnet will have a 2-4 hour downtime as the Optimism team performs the upgrade.

In preparation for this upgrade, we've partnered with Optimismâ€™s team to ensure a smooth transition plan for the Chainlink Data Feeds and Chainlink Automation services that support your dApps.

When Chainlink services resume normal operations, we'll notify you through our standard communication channels.

PLEASE NOTE: During the downtime, please do not consume Chainlink Data Feeds or use Chainlink Automation services until we update you of the services availability. If you are actively consuming Chainlink Data Feeds or using Chainlink Automation on Optimism, we advise pausing your protocol operation in advance of the Bedrock upgrade. You can resume once Chainlink services are available for use.

Please let us know if you have any questions.

Hey ArbitrumDAO! 

:offchain: Offchain Labs recently released the code https://github.com/OffchainLabs/stylus and public testnet for Arbitrum Stylus! :Stylus: 

What is Stylus?ğŸ‘‡

Arbitrum Stylus allows developers to use both traditional EVM tools and WASM-compatible languages like Rust, C, and C++ to build applications on Arbitrum Nitro chains!

Stylus dramatically lowers gas costs and enables new resource-intensive blockchain usecases like alternative signature schemes, larger generative art libraries, C++ based gaming, and compute-heavy AI models that were previously impractical.

What's next on the DAO front?ğŸ‘‡

Since Arbitrum One and Arbitrum Nova are DAO-governed, it will be up to the DAO to vote on upgrading these chains to include Stylus support.

Security Council Elections AMA ğŸ’™

Today, we are having a space with Offchain Labs, for them to walk us through the implementation on chain smart contract suite for a secure on chain election system.

ğŸ—“ï¸ 4th August 2023, 2:30 PM ET
ğŸ“ https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1yoKMZwjVODGQ?s=20

The following constitutional proposal to update the security council election date is now live on snapshot!ğŸ‘‡:arbblue: :one~1: :nova: 

https://snapshot.org/#/arbitrumfoundation.eth/proposal/0x5e43fdcaa085476a7be4fb638dd57f7b3f6b708fbbbe1380e54da126c7a095d2

The motivation to change the electionâ€™s start date is to provide time for the implementation to be completed, security audits to be performed, for the community to gain confidence in the quality of its implementation & for the Arbitrum DAO to vote on a separate Constitutional AIP to install an on-chain election system.

Gm Arbinauts! ğŸ’™

The first Arbitrum Security Council elections are scheduled to start on the 15th of September â€˜23.
As part of its governance, the Arbitrum DAO incorporates a Security Council that can take certain emergency and non-emergency actions, and there are important considerations for the community.

To provide the community with a secure on-chain election system, we have engaged Off Chain Labs and Tally to implement the on-chain smart contract suite and integrate the election system in their front end.

As the implementation continues, we want to keep the community informed since this is a critical part of the system.

You can check out this new forum post about the architecture and provide technical feedback back to the team:
Proposal: Security Council Elections Proposed Implementation Spec
https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/proposal-security-council-elections-proposed-implementation-spec/15425

We have put together a new proposal that seeks consent from the Arbitrum DAO to modify the start date of the election:
Proposal: Update Security Council Election Start Date to Ensure Time for Security Audit
https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/proposal-update-security-council-election-start-date-to-ensure-time-for-security-audit/15426

The motivation for a new start date is threefold:
1) Allow for both the smart contract and user interface implementation to be completed,
2) Time to audit the smart contracts alongside resolving any identified issues,
3)  Allow the Arbitrum DAO to review, gain confidence, and vote to install the election software.

We hope everyone is excited about pursuing an on-chain election that empowers the Arbitrum DAO to propose, vote and install new security council members!

*Find more about this here
https://twitter.com/arbitrum/status/1679932572195799065?s=20

Hello Arbinauts!:arbiblobblue: 

The Arbitrum DAO overwhelmingly voted for AIP-1.1:
https://www.tally.xyz/gov/arbitrum/proposal/70545629960586317780628692755032548222173912190231545322320044688071893662480

AIP-1.1 relates to the Arbitrum Foundation's budget. It states that our treasury of 700m ARB must be locked in a vesting contract. The treasury should be released to the Foundation over a 4 year horizon:
https://arbiscan.io/address/0x15533b77981cDa0F85c4F9a485237DF4285D6844#code

The vesting contract is an important tool to allow the Arbitrum DAO to hold the Arbitrum Foundation accountable. The DAO has the authority to remove, shorten, or extend the vesting period.

The final step to complete AIP-1.1 requires the Arbitrum Foundation to send the 700m ARB treasury to the vesting contract. This transfer will happen shortly and you can watch it here: https://arbiscan.io/address/0xc24E24383120669512a336fB3B5B19aFB4CC2a56

Finally, the completion of AIP-1.1 and AIP-1.2 represents one small step for the Arbitrum DAO, but one giant leap for the Arbitrum ecosystem :arbblue: :one~1: :nova:
